intro: Gilipus, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Gilipus has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural landscapes.
